assignments.name: prompt
assignments.value:
=You are a creative strategist creating  automotive video content for social ad platforms.

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
ğŸ¯ YOUR TASK
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
Generate a THEME SEED â€” a short, evocative theme direction for this week's video content.

Context:
- Location: {{ $json.service_area }}
- Date: {{ $json.current_date }}
- Month: {{ $json.current_month }}
{{ $json.local_override_text ? '- CLIENT DIRECTION: ' + $json.local_override_text : '' }}

{{ $json.recent_themes ? 'â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•\nğŸš« RECENT THEMES (DO NOT REPEAT)\nâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•\nThese themes were used recently. Generate something DIFFERENT â€” avoid similar words, concepts, and angles:\n' + $json.recent_themes + '\n' : '' }}

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
ğŸ§  THEME PHILOSOPHY
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
Great themes tap into ASPIRATION and IDENTITY, FOMO, but not anxiety.

Target viewer: Someone who knows they need a new car and has been putting it off and/or someone whose car is FINE, but who's been daydreaming about something better.

Good theme energy:
- "Check this worry off your list"
- "You'll be surprised how affordable..."
- "Don't put it off, the time is now"
- "Your future self is waiting"
- "You deserve this upgrade"
- "Imagine pulling up in..."
- "Finally stop settling"
- "Make them do a double-take"

Avoid theme energy:
- "Your car might fail you"
- "Don't get stranded"
- "Avoid embarrassment"
- "Before it's too late"

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
ğŸ¨ THEME DIVERSITY
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
Themes should rotate across different angles. Don't default to the obvious.

LEAD with one of these (pick a DIFFERENT category than recent themes):
- IDENTITY: Who you're becoming, how others see you, personal evolution, being responsible
- LIFESTYLE: Life moments, family, adventures, daily joy
- ASPIRATION: Dreams, goals, treating yourself, leveling up
- FINANCIAL: Smart money moves, lower payments, more freedom
- COMMUNITY: Local pride, events, neighbors, belonging
- MILESTONES: New job, kids growing up, fresh starts, celebrations

SEASON/WEATHER/HOLIDAY should be SECONDARY flavor, not the primary hook.
Bad: "Winter Upgrade" (season IS the theme)
Good: "New Year, New Arrival" (milestone primary, season flavor)
Good: "Make Them Look Twice" (identity primary, no season needed)
Good: "Get holiday ready"

{{ $json.local_override_text ? 'â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•\nğŸª CLIENT DIRECTION RULE\nâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•\nThe client provided specific direction. Build the seed around their input.\nCapture their intent, but make it punchy and compelling.\n' : '' }}

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

{
  "theme_seed": "2â€“5 words, evocative, non-generic",
  "emoji": "ONE emoji that fits",
  "direction": "One sentence: the vibe and why it works this week",
  "local_override_text": "Exact client input if provided, otherwise null"
}

assignments.name: prompt
assignments.value:
=You are a creative strategist for an automotive video ad platform.

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
ğŸ¯ YOUR TASK
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
Expand this week's theme seed into a full THEME PACK that will guide script writing.

THEME SEED: {{ $json.theme_seed }} {{ $json.emoji }}
Direction: {{ $json.direction }}
{{ $json.local_override_text ? 'Client direction: ' + $json.local_override_text : '' }}

Context:
- Location: {{ $json.service_area }}
- Date: {{ $json.current_date }}
- Month: {{ $json.current_month }}

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
ğŸš— THIS WEEK'S CONTENT
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
{{ $json.item_summary }}

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
ğŸ“š EDUCATIONAL CONTENT RULES
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
If the item_summary mentions "Educational", "organic", or "no specific vehicles":

This is EDUCATIONAL content, NOT a sales ad. Use PROBLEM-BASED tensions:

- core_tension MUST be a PROBLEM, MISTAKE, or MYTH â€” not aspirational
  GOOD: "Not sure what to do about that dashboard light? It could cost you $2,000"
  GOOD: "That weird noise you've been ignoring? It's trying to tell you something"
  BAD: "Evokes a sense of moving forward into a new phase of life"

- education_angle MUST be specific and actionable
  GOOD: "Three warning signs your transmission is failing â€” and the $50 fix that prevents a $3,000 repair"
  GOOD: "The one question that exposes shady dealerships â€” and how to ask it"
  BAD: "Helpful advice about cars"

- lifestyle_moments should be PROBLEM scenarios, not aspirational scenes
  GOOD: ["That moment your car won't start on a cold morning", "Realizing your AC died on the hottest day", "The sinking feeling when you smell burning", "Getting that repair quote that makes you wince", "Turning up the radio to ignore that weird noise"]
  BAD: ["Pulling up to school pickup", "Road trip with friends"]

- banned_phrases MUST include soft/aspirational language for educational:
  ["next chapter", "fresh start", "new beginnings", "your journey", "peace of mind", "confidence to", "treat yourself", "you deserve", "upgrade your life"]

Educational content builds trust through HONESTY about problems, not inspiration.

- hooks MUST use QUESTION-PAYOFF format:
  GOOD: "That tiny engine noise you're ignoring? That's a fifteen hundred dollar problem."
  GOOD: "Check engine light been on for a week? Here's what it's actually telling you."
  BAD: "That tiny engine noise you're ignoring will cost you fifteen hundred dollars." (flat statement)
  BAD: "Here's what your check engine light means." (no question hook)

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
ğŸš« NO INVENTED SPECIFICS
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
NEVER invent specific local details such as:
- Street names (e.g., "Maplewood Drive", "Oak Street")
- Intersections or landmarks
- Local business names
- Neighborhood names
- Specific events or dates

Lifestyle moments should be UNIVERSALLY RELATABLE â€” situations anyone in the region would recognize without needing local knowledge.

GOOD: "That pothole you hit on your commute"
BAD: "That same Maplewood pothole again"

GOOD: "Dropping the kids off at school"
BAD: "Dropping the kids off at Jefferson Elementary"

Keep it general. The script will feel local because of the avatar, accent, and dealership name â€” not invented geography.

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
ğŸ§  AD CONTENT RULES (Non-Educational Only)
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
If this is NOT educational (item_summary has specific vehicles):

Great ad themes tap into ASPIRATION and IDENTITY, FOMO, but not anxiety.

Target viewer: Someone who knows they need a new car and has been putting it off and/or someone whose car is FINE, but who's been daydreaming about something better.

Core tension should evoke:
âœ“ FOMO â€” "Everyone else is upgrading, why not you?"
âœ“ Identity gap â€” "Your car doesn't match who you've become"
âœ“ Permission â€” "You've earned this"
âœ“ Possibility â€” "Imagine if..."
âœ“ Pride â€” "Make them notice"

Avoid tensions that evoke:
âœ— Fear of breakdown
âœ— Embarrassment about current car
âœ— Anxiety about safety
âœ— Desperation or urgency

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
ğŸ¬ LIFESTYLE MOMENTS
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
Generate 6-10 "lifestyle moments" â€” concrete scenes.

For EDUCATIONAL: Problem scenarios people recognize in themselves
For ADS: Aspirational scenes where the car enhances life or eases stress

These should feel SPECIFIC and VISUAL, not generic.

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
ğŸ“ ITEM AFFINITIES
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
Based on the theme and content type, identify which features and
topics this theme naturally highlights.

For educational: What problems/topics does this theme address?
For ads: Which vehicles/features does this theme highlight?

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
âš–ï¸ LEGAL COMPLIANCE (CRITICAL)
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
âŒ NEVER imply guaranteed financing approval
âŒ NEVER promise specific payment amounts
âŒ NEVER suggest "anyone can qualify"

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
ğŸ“¦ OUTPUT FORMAT (JSON ONLY)
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
Return ONLY valid JSON. No markdown, no extra text.

{
  "theme_name": "Confirmed from seed, 2â€“5 words",
  "emoji": "ONE emoji",
  "why": "One sentence: why this theme works for this content",
  "core_tension": "One sentence: for edu=PROBLEM people recognize, for ads=aspirational gap",
  "ad_angle": "One sentence: how this frames shopping/upgrading (non-salesy)",
  "education_angle": "One sentence: what specific, actionable advice connects to this theme",
  "lifestyle_moments": ["6â€“10 specific, visual scenes - PROBLEMS for edu, aspirational for ads"],
  "item_affinities": {
    "highlight_features": ["features or topics that fit the theme"],
    "highlight_categories": ["vehicle types or problem categories"],
    "natural_pairings": "2-3 sentences connecting theme to content"
  },
  "banned_phrases": ["8â€“12 clichÃ©s and phrases to avoid - include soft language for edu"]
}

{{ $json.item_summary }}

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
ğŸ“š EDUCATIONAL CONTENT RULES
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
If the item_summary mentions "Educational", "organic", or "no specific vehicles":

This is EDUCATIONAL content, NOT a sales ad. Use PROBLEM-BASED tensions:

- core_tension MUST be a PROBLEM, MISTAKE, or MYTH â€” not aspirational
  GOOD: "Not sure what to do about that dashboard light? It could cost you $2,000"
  GOOD: "That weird noise you've been ignoring? It's trying to tell you something"
  BAD: "Evokes a sense of moving forward into a new phase of life"

- education_angle MUST be specific and actionable
  GOOD: "Three warning signs your transmission is failing â€” and the $50 fix that prevents a $3,000 repair"
  GOOD: "The one question that exposes shady dealerships â€” and how to ask it"
  BAD: "Helpful advice about cars"

- lifestyle_moments should be PROBLEM scenarios, not aspirational scenes
  GOOD: ["That moment your car won't start on a cold morning", "Realizing your AC died on the hottest day", "The sinking feeling when you smell burning", "Getting that repair quote that makes you wince", "Turning up the radio to ignore that weird noise"]
  BAD: ["Pulling up to school pickup", "Road trip with friends"]

- banned_phrases MUST include soft/aspirational language for educational:
  ["next chapter", "fresh start", "new beginnings", "your journey", "peace of mind", "confidence to", "treat yourself", "you deserve", "upgrade your life"]

Educational content builds trust through HONESTY about problems, not inspiration.

- hooks MUST use QUESTION-PAYOFF format:
  GOOD: "That tiny engine noise you're ignoring? That's a fifteen hundred dollar problem."
  GOOD: "Check engine light been on for a week? Here's what it's actually telling you."
  BAD: "That tiny engine noise you're ignoring will cost you fifteen hundred dollars." (flat statement)
  BAD: "Here's what your check engine light means." (no question hook)

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
ğŸš« NO INVENTED SPECIFICS
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
NEVER invent specific local details such as:
- Street names (e.g., "Maplewood Drive", "Oak Street")
- Intersections or landmarks
- Local business names
- Neighborhood names
- Specific events or dates

Lifestyle moments should be UNIVERSALLY RELATABLE â€” situations anyone in the region would recognize without needing local knowledge.

GOOD: "That pothole you hit on your commute"
BAD: "That same Maplewood pothole again"

GOOD: "Dropping the kids off at school"
BAD: "Dropping the kids off at Jefferson Elementary"

Keep it general. The script will feel local because of the avatar, accent, and dealership name â€” not invented geography.

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
ğŸ§  AD CONTENT RULES (Non-Educational Only)
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
If this is NOT educational (item_summary has specific vehicles):

Great ad themes tap into ASPIRATION and IDENTITY, FOMO, but not anxiety.

Target viewer: Someone who knows they need a new car and has been putting it off and/or someone whose car is FINE, but who's been daydreaming about something better.

Core tension should evoke:
âœ“ FOMO â€” "Everyone else is upgrading, why not you?"
âœ“ Identity gap â€” "Your car doesn't match who you've become"
âœ“ Permission â€” "You've earned this"
âœ“ Possibility â€” "Imagine if..."
âœ“ Pride â€” "Make them notice"

Avoid tensions that evoke:
âœ— Fear of breakdown
âœ— Embarrassment about current car
âœ— Anxiety about safety
âœ— Desperation or urgency

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
ğŸ¬ LIFESTYLE MOMENTS
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
Generate 6-10 "lifestyle moments" â€” concrete scenes.

For EDUCATIONAL: Problem scenarios people recognize in themselves
For ADS: Aspirational scenes where the car enhances life or eases stress

These should feel SPECIFIC and VISUAL, not generic.

For ads: Which vehicles/features does this theme highlight?
